items.title:
Hey peeps in Kansas or peeps who know peeps in Kansas!!
I'm doing a casting that‚Ä¶
items.summary:
Hey peeps in Kansas or peeps who know peeps in Kansas!!
I'm doing a casting that is specificaly looking for real Kansans. Is that how you say it? I should know, I married a green eye'd Kansas boy... but anyway, back to the point. I'm looking for a bunch of people and they can be from anywhere in the state. The filming team will come to you or at least pretty darn close to you.
The pay is $500 per person - even if your whole family books it
Usage: OOH, CTV, Social, Web, Print, Banners, Industrial, in perpetuity
It'd be awesome if you were actual BCBS customers, but you don't have to be! And you don't need to have any on camera experience.
If you fit the bill, please send an email with a photo of you and a little blurb about you and why you fit the project. Send it to shauna@sebcasting.com by end of day Friday Aug 29th.
Here are some specific people we're looking for, but we are also loking for just your regular Kansas folks too.
1) Farmer - We‚Äôre looking for a real farmer, any age, who works the land while managing a visible health challenge. This could be a prosthetic arm, an insulin pump, a hearing aid, or anything that shows their body has been through something and they are still out there doing the work and living their life.
This is not about overcoming a set-back in a glossy, commercial way. It is about the everyday toughness of someone who gets up before sunrise, feeds the animals, fixes the tractor, and keeps going. Dirt under the nails, sun on the face, humor in the voice. Someone who looks like they actually know what calluses feel like.
All races and genders are welcome. We want authenticity over polish. People not pretending to be farmers but real ones.
2) A student athlete - A real-deal young athlete, age 15‚Äì20, who‚Äôs currently in the thick of rehabbing a noticeable injury. This could be an ACL, ankle, shoulder. Something that leaves a brace, crutches, or scar, something that we as the viewer can see and feel in a split second.
We‚Äôre not shooting for shiny highlight reels or staged comebacks. We want the raw in-between. A kid still rocking the team hoodie at physical therapy. The one who hears the squeak of the gym floor but has to watch from the sideline. Someone with grit, humor, and honesty in how they carry themselves.
All races and backgrounds are welcome. We‚Äôre especially interested in faces and stories that look like real life, not polished models, or someone who is playing a role, but the real people. They should have a look of determination on their face. This isn‚Äôt a set-back but a stage for what comes next.
3) A graveyard shift worker - This isn‚Äôt about polished smiles or hero shots. It‚Äôs the tired eyes at 3 a.m., the coÔ¨Äee that barely keeps you upright, the quiet moments in fluorescent light when the world feels stuck in pause. Someone who looks like they know what it feels like to walk out of work and see the sun rise before they‚Äôve even gone to bed.
All races, genders, and ages are welcome. We want someone real, not staged. A person who carries the weight of the night shift in the way they stand, move, and speak.
Prefer BCBS members
4) A 4H kid - We‚Äôre not after a glossy champion. We want the kid who smells like hay by noon, whose boots are dusty, and whose face says they‚Äôve been up since sunrise. Someone who knows long rides in a pickup, the heat that sticks to your skin, and the noise of the barns drowning out the noise of the competition.
All races and backgrounds welcome. We want real Kansas kids who treat the fairgrounds like a second home, kids who know the dust, the heat, and the rhythm of competition better than the tourists ever will.
5) Hunters & Fishers - We are looking for real Kansans. Not models, not overly polished actors, but people who tell the true story of this state. People who represent Kansas in the way they stand, the way they work, the way they are. Our audience should be able to look at them and
think: that could be me, that could be my neighbor, that could be my family.
We are not looking for perfection. We are looking for authenticity. Lives that have been well-lived. Hands that show they have worked. Eyes that carry both resilience and pride.
People that without a single word,but a single look, can tell you where they are from and what they stand for, in an instant.
This cast should feel like Kansas itself, wide, varied, and diverse. From big cities, small towns, and open plains. Every age, every background, and every walk of life. People whose presence says something true before they even have to talk.
6) Fossil diggers/Rock hounds - We are not looking for perfection. We are looking for authenticity. Lives that have been well-lived. Hands that show they have worked. Eyes that carry both resilience and pride.
People that without a single word,but a single look, can tell you where they are from and what they stand for, in an instant.
This cast should feel like Kansas itself, wide, varied, and diverse. From big cities, small towns, and open plains. Every age, every background, and every walk of life. People whose presence says something true before they even have to talk.
7) College students - Young people who tell the story of campus life in Kansas. We are looking for real Kansans. Not models, not overly polished actors, but people who
tell the true story of this state. People who represent Kansas in the way they stand, the
way they work, the way they are. Our audience should be able to look at them and think: that could be me, that could be my neighbor, that could be my family. We are not looking for perfection. We are looking for authenticity. This cast should feel like Kansas itself, wide, varied, and diverse. From big cities, small
towns, and open plains. Every age, every background, and every walk of life. People whose presence says something true before they even have to talk.

items.title: Calling all Denver film students! Are you ready to get some serious hands-on exp‚Ä¶
items.summary:
Calling all Denver film students! Are you ready to get some serious hands-on experience and build your portfolio with a project that's anything but ordinary? We're seeking talented and enthusiastic crew members for our short film, "And Then Jeff Killed Everyone" a dark comedy horror that twists the tropes of found footage and paranormal investigation shows.

This is an unpaid opportunity, but it's an incredible chance to contribute to a unique vision and gain valuable on-set experience that will help boost your reel and resume.

We're specifically looking for:

**Editor** **(Familiar with Found Footage & Paranormal Show Tropes)**

We need an editor who lives and breathes the aesthetics of found footage and paranormal investigation TV shows. Think jump cuts, shaky cam, sudden audio spikes, and the slow, creeping dread of a ghost hunt gone wrong. Your keen eye for pacing and your ability to craft tension and unexpected comedic beats will be essential. This is a chance to show off your understanding of genre conventions and subvert them!

**Makeup Artists** **(Specializing in Gore Effects)**

We're on the hunt for makeup artists with a flair for gore effects. Our script features some truly memorable (and messy) moments, and we need your skills to make them look horrifyingly real. This is your chance to showcase your practical effects abilities and create striking visuals for your portfolio.

If you're passionate about filmmaking and eager to gain practical experience on a project that defies expectations, we want to hear from you!

**Submit your reel/portfolio and resume to chrismusick23@gmail.com**

items.title: Hey Denver actors & acting students! Are you looking for an incredible opportuni‚Ä¶
items.summary:
Hey Denver actors & acting students! Are you looking for an incredible opportunity to build your reel, gain valuable set experience, and bring a unique character to life on screen? We're casting for ***"And Then Jeff Killed Everyone,"*** a dark comedy horror pilot that playfully twists the paranormal investigation genre.

This is an unpaid student film, but it's a chance to work on a distinctive script, get high-quality footage for your reel, and connect with a passionate local film crew. We're looking for dedicated actors to fill these roles:

**Available Roles:**
* **Don Logins: **(Male, 20s-30s) Think Zak Bagans and Ed Hardy t-shirts. He's intense, self-indulgent, with gelled hair and an over-the-top style. Don is convinced of his own coolness and obsessed with proving ghosts are real, mostly for the fame. A fantastic opportunity for an actor who can lean into an exaggerated, yet committed, performance.
* **Nicole:** (Female, 20s-30s) Our kind, soft-spoken, and friendly Team Case Researcher. She's genuinely passionate about finding evidence of life after death and grounds the team with her sincerity. This role needs an actor who can convey warmth and a quiet determination.
* **Casey:** (Male, 20s-30s) Very intelligent and level-headed, with a dry wit. He approaches the paranormal with a healthy dose of skepticism but genuinely wants to see a ghost. We're looking for an actor who can deliver intelligent humor and a grounded presence.
* **Frankie:** (Male, 20s-30s) From Boston with a heavy accent, Frankie's a bit squirrelly and prone to screwing up. He's more of a film student than a paranormal investigator, initially a skeptic, and often finds himself in over his head. Great for an actor who excels at physical comedy and portrays nervous energy.
* **Stefania:** (Female, 20s-40s) A very no-nonsense medium with a Natasha Lyonne-type vibe. She's mostly nice to others but can be blunt. She claims to be a medium but is well aware that many think it's BS (and thinks those people can screw themselves). This role is perfect for an actor who can balance a strong, confident personality with comedic timing and a subtle layer of deception.

**If you're ready to dive into a fun and memorable project, please submit your headshot and resume to Chrismusick23@gmail.com. We can't wait to see your auditions!**

items.title:
This is me (and Zoe), ten years into a journey that almost never started.

At 47‚Ä¶
items.summary:
This is me (and Zoe), ten years into a journey that almost never started.

At 47, after a 16-year break, I tried to relaunch my acting career in Germany with no reel, no contacts, and very rusty skills. I had no idea how to explain the gap on my resume, and the thought of walking into a casting room again terrified me.

But giving up was not an option.

The solution hit me when I realized the problem itself was pointing the way forward. I needed training in English at a high level, and it did not exist in Munich. Flying to London, LA, or New York was unrealistic.

So I organized the workshops myself.

What happened next changed everything.

Instead of stumbling around in the dark trying to figure it out again, I could hit the ground running. Whenever I needed something like showreel material, headshots, the right kind of training, I organized it and got what I needed. If I had tried to piece it all together on my own, it would have taken ten times as long, and I did not have that kind of time.

That approach became my foundation. It is what eventually opened doors to work with studios like A24, Netflix, and Hallmark.

Along the way, I got world-class training for free as the organizer. A community of actors formed around those workshops. And unexpectedly, it also turned into steady income.

Here is the breakthrough: I always believed you had to "make it" before you could make money as a creative. What I discovered is that the journey itself can pay for itself.

Use what you need, whether that is training, practice, connections, or visibility, and shape it into something that lets other people get what they need too. That way you move your craft forward, build real relationships, get seen, and the process funds itself.

At first, I thought this only worked for actors because that is where I started. But the more I shared my story, the more I heard the same frustrations from other creatives: photographers, writers, artisans, even people into things like fermentation or traditional crafts. That's when it clicked. This approach is not just about acting. It can work anywhere someone is willing to use what they need to build what they want.

Ten years later, I am still living this way. I am constantly building skills, deepening connections, getting more visible in my craft, and funding it all as I go.

I am sharing this because I know too many people who keep their passions in the "someday" box. They wait until they feel "ready" or "expert enough" before letting themselves imagine it could actually support them.

But what if the very thing you think is holding you back is actually your starting point to a creative life that fits?

üëâ For me, it was not having reel material or training. What‚Äôs been that thing for you?

Want to learn how to speak in different Southern American accents? Join me on a tour of how people talk across the South -  from the bayous of Louisiana to the hills of Kentucky, from Texas plains to Carolina coasts.

You'll learn to hear and speak in a variety of Southern accents, including:
Texas (classic and modern regional variations)

Deep South (Georgia, Mississippi, Alabama, and Louisiana)

Florida (Panhandle to Miami)

The Carolinas, both North and South

Tennessee, Kentucky and the Appalachian edge

Arkansas & Oklahoma (Southern-Midwest blend)

This workshop will get you on the road to sounding more authentic in front of discerning audiences when performing characters from the American South.

See y‚Äôall there!

items.title:
# CASTING CALL: JOIN OUR ACTING PODCAST

When a group of actors sit around a tab‚Ä¶
items.summary:
# CASTING CALL: JOIN OUR ACTING PODCAST

When a group of actors sit around a table and use their spoken words to portray characters all going on an adventure together, that's called a tabletop roleplaying game (TTRPG). Our gaming group plays a variety of tabletop roleplaying games and publishes the audio as a podcast. Example famous ttrpg podcasts: Critical Role, The Adventure Zone, etc. We react as our character to the scenario presented by the game master. We respond to challenges, overcome obstacles, make jokes and laugh with our fellow acting friends. Would you enjoy acting in-character for a podcast audience? Join us.

# When we play:

Weekends. Both European and American time zones. Joining us doesn't commit you to every weekend. Instead, we pick games we want to try and sign up for those calendar spots.

# How long we play / what it‚Äôs like:

Our members sit at their microphones for four hours talking their way through an adventure using their words and laughter to entertain each other. We use theater of the mind, saying out loud how far away targets are instead of looking at combat maps on a screen. The recordings are high quality, and we air the audio as a podcast. Don‚Äôt worry, we don‚Äôt publish our names or faces.

# System played:

We get to learn and play a different tabletop roleplaying game (ttrpg) system each session. There‚Äôs no financial burden to you. The systems are either free to everyone or we were sent a free promotional copy from its creator.

# Oneshot or campaign:

Both. Like a traditional campaign, we repeatedly meet familiar non player characters (NPCs), facing challenges and experiencing long term character growth. We play our same character for a year. Our characters start at low power in January, grow to epic max fighting strength by December, then retire. Like a oneshot, each individual episode opens with a beginning to its plot, and the exploration of its story ends after four hours.

# Game Mastering (GMing):

We rotate so that everyone is invited to be a player and a game master if they want. The GM gets to pick which ttrpg we play that weekend. If you find a fun ttrpg you want to try, you can sign up as the GM and be confident that there will be players excited to play with you. If you prefer to be a player every time that‚Äôs cool, too. Our members don't have to GM ever if they want a break from it. Getting to pick how often you GM really helps relieve burnout. GM as often as makes you happy.

# You can vibe check past games:

We're on itunes, spotify, youtube, and all the podcast apps. Our cast rotates. Skip around and listen to snippets from a few episodes to see which of our members you want to play with first. The episodes aren't all great, but we have fun together. This isn't a job. It's a hobby, a way to relax and laugh meeting new people who slowly over time become lifelong friends. It's okay to miss games; you aren‚Äôt expected to be present for every session. The opt-in format naturally minimizes table trouble because you can see who‚Äôs signed up to GM and play in a game before you join it, and can pick dates that have people you‚Äôre looking forward to playing with.

# Joining:

To join, email us at FirebreathingKittensPodcast at gmail dot com and tell us about your equipment. Our minimum requirement is 24 bit audio (not 16 bit). If you don‚Äôt know what 24 bit audio means that‚Äôs not a problem, the new members tab of FirebreathingKittensPodcast dot com has an equipment section that explains what all the microphone words mean with pictures and videos. We welcome members of all experience levels and will train you. The new members tab also has info about our format and answers to frequently asked questions. Minimum age 21 years old. We reply to all emails from people who have 24 bit audio within three days with a support agreement for you to sign, and then will guide you through character creation and train you how to record great audio.

items.title:
American actors in Montreal? 

We are looking for american speaking male talents‚Ä¶
items.summary:
American actors in Montreal? 

We are looking for american speaking male talents to audition for a Non Union voice and motion capture project ''Washington Irving's Hologram''. 
Voice should sound 40-55 years old but it's ok if you look younger. No beards
This casting welcomes submissions from all backgrounds
 
Project: Village of Sleepy Hollow near New York
Rate is 1500$ Non Union
Recording date: Week of July 4th
Production type: Mocap, hologram for a circus
Recording duration: 1 full day with Mocap
Deadline for submissions : Monday June 27th @ 12 pm

Role description:
Looking for a very good actor who can voice a learned six minute monologue for a holographic depiction of Washington Irving, writer of ‚ÄúThe Legend of Sleepy Hollow‚Äù. This role requires a  sounding American Accent. The actor cannot be claustrophobic. He will have to wear a motion capture suit + facial capture helmet.

Submissions:
Please forward self-tapes visual auditions to sondageperspectives@gmail.com with the following assets:
- A video recording of yourself acting the suggested highlighted lines
- A resume and picture if one is available

Note: Only your voice will be showcased for 4 weeks during the Winchester Art Circus presentation with the other characters at 5 presentations per week.
See below the link  and script :
 
script : 
‚ÄúI sealed this letter 200 years ago with the promise to return to tell the REAL story of what I meant by ‚ÄúThe Legend‚Äù. And that time has now come...
Well now‚Ä¶this is quite the cozy gathering. Welcome. I am Washington Irving.
This is an old story I have to tell, a two-hundred year old story of ghosts and goblins, guile and gullibility, of contests and conquests.
You‚Äôll see some rivalry, a dose of unrequited infatuation, a handful of greed and bullying. But at the bottom of it all, when you get down to the last draw of your ale, it‚Äôs just the plain nature of the human condition that tells its own story...in a most peculiar way.
It‚Äôs said that legends are the tall tales told to make sense of the things too great, or too terrifying to believe.
The thing about legends is: sometimes they‚Äôre true.
Welcome to our legend‚Ä¶The Legend of Sleepy Hollow‚Ä¶‚Äù

Link :
[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington_Irving](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington_Irving)

items.title:
Dear People! 
Please make sure you always check if the offer is legit before sen‚Ä¶
items.summary:
Dear People! 
Please make sure you always check if the offer is legit before sending any personal data to anyone!
Scammers are everywhere.

Especially with big events and well-known brands, you should always get an official e-mail address and name of the agency handling the casting that you can then double check to make sure they are legit and handling this particular casting. 

No big events cast Performers via private messages on Facebook. 

I just warned people under one post here and was blocked by the person who wrote it, which proves to me it was a scam.

i know that finding jobs is tough right now, but don‚Äôt let evil people take advantage of you üíúüíúüíú don‚Äôt rush, double check, keep your data private.

Lots of love!

items.summary:
üé¨ **CASTING CALL ‚Äì ‚ÄúHorizons‚Äù (Short Film ‚Äì Edinburgh)** üé¨

**TITLE:** *Horizons*
**PRODUCTION TYPE:** Short Film (10 Minutes)
**LOCATION:** Edinburgh, Scotland
**PRODUCTION DATE:** Shooting July 2nd‚Äì7th, 2025
**PAID, UNPAID OR PROFIT SHARE:** Paid (Student Project ‚Äì Currently Crowdfunding)
**PRODUCER OR PRODUCTION COMPANY:** Edinburgh Napier Masters Project ‚Äì Screen Academy Scotland
**HOW TO APPLY:** Visit [https://actorsandextras.com/casting-calls](https://actorsandextras.com/casting-calls) for casting details

**ROLE BREAKDOWN:**
*Horizons* follows Fiona, who returns home for her mother‚Äôs birthday and is confronted by the emotional weight of absent family and her mother's unsettling indifference. This heartfelt drama explores the clash between tradition and change across generations.

üé≠ **Roles Casting:**

**FIONA**
* Female, 40s
* Emotionally conflicted, driven to hold her family together
* Haunted by a sense of loss and disconnection, clinging to tradition
* Strong dramatic range required

**MOIRA**
* Female, 70s
* Outgoing and social, recently widowed
* Trying to enjoy life despite changes and questions about her mental wellbeing
* Warm, resilient character, sometimes frustrated by Fiona‚Äôs concern

üé• **Auditions:**
* In-person: Sunday 15th & Monday 16th June (Edinburgh)
* Self-tapes welcome

üì£ **Additional Info:**
The production is part of a final Masters project. Crowdfunding is underway to support the cast, with further details available on the [Horizons Crowdfunder page](https://www.crowdfunder.co.uk/p/horizons-shortfilm).

items.title: Casting Call! Warrington/Manchester area, late October/early November filming da‚Ä¶
items.summary:
Casting Call! Warrington/Manchester area, late October/early November filming dates.

We are looking for one Female and one Male actor to play the lead roles in our upcoming short film, ‚ÄòOh, Death‚Äô, a comedy drama exploring themes of choice, family, death and morality. Synopsis below;

After his abrupt and unexpected death, Peter is almost elated to be greeted by an Agent of Death and to discover that there is an afterlife. Peter believes he‚Äôs done enough good to earn his ticket Up, but when sarcastic and bored Margo tells him he‚Äôs going Down, Peter has only a short time to convince her to change her mind to avoid an eternity of punishment.

The Roles-

Peter- 
Male
Age- 35-45

Personality- Selfish, uncaring, wants to be good but rarely musters up the effort to do so

Requirements for the role- Willing to learn a few Gaelic phrases

Margo- 
Female
Age- 30-40

Personality- Sarcastic, funny, rude, nonchalant yet an imposing figure

Requirements for the role- Willing to learn a few Gaelic phrases

Due to the limited budget of our film, roles are unpaid but we will cover the cost of travel and provide/pay for food and drink. Filming will take place in Warrington/Manchester area, filming dates are;

Saturday 25th October
Friday 7th November
Saturday 8th November

If you‚Äôre interested, we‚Äôd love to hear from you! 

Send an email to deadhorsestudios2025@gmail.com stating which character you‚Äôd like to play and a link to your showreel if you have one! Shortlisted actors will be given more character information and will be asked to record a self tape of one of the scenes before we make our final decision.

You can visit our YouTube or Instagram page, Dead Horse Studios, to check out a little of what we‚Äôre about, including our latest short film, ‚ÄòThe Block‚Äô that was entered into the Cannes Film Festival earlier this year.

We can‚Äôt wait to hear from you,
Andrew and the rest of the Dead Horse Studios crew.

items.title: Casting "The Quiet Soul," an independent short film exploring themes of isolatio‚Ä¶
items.summary:
Casting "The Quiet Soul," an independent short film exploring themes of isolation, resilience, and the quiet strength of human connection. The story follows Nathan, a young athlete whose life is suddenly upended when he suffers a stroke, leaving him with locked-in syndrome. Trapped within his own body, Nathan faces the challenge of reconnecting with the world around him, rediscovering his independence, and navigating the emotional distance that has grown between him and those he loves.

"The Quiet Soul" is a story of enduring connection, showing how love and perseverance can bridge the deepest barriers, even when words are no longer possible.

Vi er en gruppe filmstuderende, der arbejder p√• en drama-dokumentar om hekseprocessen mod Maren Spliids i 1641 ‚Äì en af de mest kendte hekseafbr√¶ndinger i Danmark.

Vi s√∏ger nu skuespillere til f√∏lgende roller:

‚∏ª

‚Ä¢ Maren Spliids (hovedrolle, kvinde, ca. 30‚Äì45 √•r)

En st√¶rk, selvst√¶ndig kvinde, der sammen med sin mand (Lauritz) driver v√¶rtshus i Ribe. Hun er kendt for sit temperament, sin stolthed og sit mod til at sige tingene, som de er ‚Äì tr√¶k, der ogs√• g√∏r hende s√•rbar i en tid, hvor kvinder helst skulle tie stille. Hun n√¶gter at bekende sig skyldig, og agter at k√¶mpe for sin frihed

‚Ä¢ Lauritz Spliids (birolle, mand, ca. 30‚Äì50 √•r)

Maren Spliids mand og medejer af byens v√¶rtshus. Han er en vellidt og anerkendt borger, men presses h√•rdt under hekseanklagerne mod hans hustru. Lauritz er splittet mellem k√¶rligheden til Maren og frygten for at miste b√•de hende og familiens anseelse.

‚Ä¢ Didrik Skr√¶dder (birolle, mand, ca. 30‚Äì45 √•r)

items.title: Altarena Playhouse (Alameda, CA) is holding auditions for the musical ***ANYTHIN‚Ä¶
items.summary:
Altarena Playhouse (Alameda, CA) is holding auditions for the musical ***ANYTHING GOES*****.**

 

Music & lyrics by Cole Porter

Original book by Guy Bolton, P.G. Wodehouse, Howard Lindsay, and Russel Crouse; revised by Timothy Crouse and John Weidman

Directed by Laura Morgan

Musical direction by Armando Fox

Choreography by Rachelle King Campodonico

March 27 ‚Äì April 26, 2026

 

Cole Porter‚Äôs *Anything Goes* is a timeless classic filled with toe-tapping melodies, witty lyrics, and spirited characters. Set aboard a transatlantic ocean liner, the musical follows an unpredictable voyage of love triangles and mistaken identities. With timeless standards like ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre the Top,‚Äù ‚ÄúI Get a Kick Out of You,‚Äù and the title song, *Anything Goes* blends romance, comedy, and show-stopping dance.

 

Auditions (by appointment):

Sunday, November 2, 6-9pm

Monday, November 3, 7-10pm

 

Callbacks (by invitation only):

Saturday, November 8, 10am-3pm.  You may or may not be called for the whole time.

 

Rehearsals begin approximately January 25. Performances are Friday and Saturday nights and Sunday matinees.   Please bring a complete list of conflicts to the audition.  No conflicts accepted during tech week.

 

**Please prepare **a 16-32 bar selection of an uptempo song in the style of the show (but preferably not from the show). Bring sheet music in the correct key; accompanist will be provided. Please bring a headshot, r√©sum√©, and audition form provided on the SignUp.

 

There will be a mandatory tap call at auditions for anyone auditioning for Reno or the Angels.  However, tap skills will be a plus for anyone auditioning, so if you have tap experience or even think you can fake it in jazz shoes, we‚Äôd love to see you at the tap call as well.  There will be at least two of the tap calls each audition night, so you should attend the one closest to your audition time.  There will be a separate movement call at callbacks for the non-tappers.    

 

Please contact Katina at artisticdirector@altarena.org should you have any questions.

 

Performers of all races, ethnicities, and genders are encouraged to audition. Non-AEA only.  These are volunteer positions, but there is a $500 expense reimbursement available for the run.

 

Visit SignUp Genius for sides, character descriptions, more information, and to make an appointment

[https://www.signupgenius.com/go/9040F4FAFAB28A2F94-58527177-anything](https://www.signupgenius.com/go/9040F4FAFAB28A2F94-58527177-anything)

** **

ROLES:

**Note**: Some roles may also understudy principals. In some cases, understudies may be scheduled for a guaranteed performance. Understudies will receive rehearsal time to ensure they are prepared to step into the role(s).

 

**Reno Sweeney **- (30s-40s) A charismatic nightclub singer and former evangelist. She is clever, funny, persuasive, and extremely confident. Strong singing and dancing required as well as comedic timing. Alto belter - G3-Eb5

**Billy Crocker** - (20s-30s) A young Wall Street broker in love with Hope.  He stows away on the ship and goes to great lengths to prevent Hope‚Äôs marriage to Lord Evelyn.  Tenor - B2-G4

**Hope Harcourt** - (20s) A young American debutante.  A dutiful daughter who is willing to marry to please her mother, despite her growing attraction to Billy.  Legit mezzo - G3-Eb5

**Moonface Martin** - (30s-50s) A somewhat failed gangster who is nowhere near as menacing as he thinks he is.  Speaks with a New York character accent. Ranked as Public Enemy #13, he longs to move up the list. Bari-tenor - Bb2-Gb4

**Bonnie** - (20s-30s) A typical gangster‚Äôs moll with a New York character accent.  Not too sad when her boyfriend misses the boat and she has her pick of sailors.  Alto - Eb4-E5

**Evelyn Oakleigh** - (30s-40s) A slightly awkward but endearing British lord with a mania for American slang.  Baritone - C2-E4

**Mrs. Harcourt **- (40s-50s) Hope‚Äôs overbearing mother concerned primarily with social standing and money. Any vocal range.

**Elisha J. Whitney/Bishop Dobson** - (40s-60s) Whitney is a successful Ivy League Wall Street banker/business tycoon, nearsighted, and a gloriously functional drunk with a huge personality. Used to snapping his fingers and having the world stop to listen.  The Bishop is a solemn and serious man of the cloth mistaken for a gangster.  Any vocal range.

**Angels** - Backup dancers and singers in Reno‚Äôs nightclub act.  Excellent tap and dance skills required.  Various ages and vocal ranges.

**Captain/Reporter/**possibly other character roles - (Open to any age) Bari-tenor or tenor

**Convert #1 and #2** - (Open to any age) New York hooligans allegedly reformed by Bishop Dobson, but they slip back easily into their old ways.  May be played by any gender and will be double-tracked with other parts.

üìç Filming Location: Los Angeles, CA

üìÖ Filming Dates: November 2025 (4-day shoot)

About the Film:

The Forever Home is a chilling feature set in the 1980s, following a haunted foster home plagued by the presence of its caretaker and six ghostly children. The short film has already built a large following online and this feature is expected to gain major exposure upon release.

Casting Roles:

6 Children (ages 8‚Äì12) ‚Äì Any gender, any ethnicity

Non-speaking roles (portraying ghost children)

No prior acting experience required ‚Äî ability to follow direction and stay in character is key

Compensation:

Non-union, unpaid

IMDb/film credits + valuable experience on a professional horror set

items.title:
**L√òNNET STATISTJOB TIL DR-DOKUMENTAR**

Til en stor DR-naturdokumentarserie om ‚Ä¶
items.summary:
**L√òNNET STATISTJOB TIL DR-DOKUMENTAR**

Til en stor DR-naturdokumentarserie om det danske vejr og dets vilde kr√¶fter, s√∏ger Koncern TV og Filmproduktion en skuespiller/statist til optagelser mandag d. 18 eller tirsdag d. 19 august. Den eksakte dato fastl√¶gges om et par dage, n√•r vi er mere sikre p√• hvordan vejret bliver den p√•g√¶ldende dag.

Scenens ramme er en badestrand hvor skuespilleren mest af alt skal ligge og nyde solens varme, med andre badeg√¶ster omkring. Der ikke nogle s√¶rlige krav til hverken k√∏n, etnicitet eller lign, men hvis du har et barn/b√∏rn som synes det kunne v√¶re sjovt at deltage, og som har tid, s√• vil det kun v√¶re dejligt at lave en naturlig badestrandssituation, med b√∏rn som ogs√• leger i sandet ved siden af.

Optagelserne indg√•r som del af en st√∏rre scene, s√• selve optagelserne regner vi ikke med vil tage meget mere end 3-4 timer, n√•r f√∏rst vi g√•r i gang.

Location er Feddet Strand ved Faxe, og optagelserne vil foreg√• i fra ved 10-11 tiden og som n√¶vnt ca 3-4 timer frem. L√∏nnen er 1.000kr.

Hvis det har din interesse, s√• send mig gerne en mail p√•: [jehp@koncern.dk](mailto:jehp@koncern.dk), skriv en PB her p√• facebook eller ring til mig p√• tlf: 31208468, s√• kan du fort√¶lle mere om dig selv, og jeg kan fort√¶lle lidt mere om programmet :)

Med venlig hilsen

Jesper Holm - tilrettel√¶gger

Koncern TV og Filmproduktion

items.title:
Bliv en del af vores sjove reklame ‚Äì Vi s√∏ger mor og b√∏rn!

Vi er et filmhold, d‚Ä¶
items.summary:
Bliv en del af vores sjove reklame ‚Äì Vi s√∏ger mor og b√∏rn!

Vi er et filmhold, der s√∏ger medvirkende til en reklamefilm for en ny serie af mintpastiller. Reklamen handler om den s√∏de, men lidt s√¶re, vane, en mor har med at slikke sine b√∏rn p√• kinden ‚Äì en k√¶rlig, men drillende gestus, der f√•r et ekstra friskt pust med vores mintpastiller.

Til dette unikke projekt s√∏ger vi:

En mor med en lang eller stor tunge. Din tunge er et centralt element i reklamen og skal bruges til at skabe en sjov og mindev√¶rdig scene. Det er derfor et vigtigt casting-kriterie. Vi l√¶gger stor v√¶gt p√•, at du har masser af varme og humor.

Tre b√∏rn (ca. 6-14 √•r), som er friske og har lyst til at v√¶re med til et sjovt projekt. Det er vigtigt for optagelserne, at b√∏rnene kan reagere naturligt p√• at blive slikket p√• kinden og ikke tr√¶kker sig eller har ubehag ved det.

Vi s√∏ger ikke n√∏dvendigvis en rigtig familie, men det er afg√∏rende, at I er √•bne, har en god portion humor og er gode til at skabe kemi sammen.

Praktisk information:

Dato: Vi filmer i ultimo oktober. Den pr√¶cise dato aftales individuelt.

Lokation: Optagelserne finder sted i Aarhus og omegn.

L√∏n: Afl√∏nning sker efter aftale.

S√•dan s√∏ger du
Hvis du t√¶nker, at I passer perfekt til rollerne, kan I ans√∏ge p√• to m√•der:

Via Messenger: Send en besked, hvor I beskriver, hvorfor I vil passe ind. Vedh√¶ft et par vellignende billeder og eventuelt en kort video, der viser jeres gode kemi.

Via mail: Send en mail til mefstrup1985@gmail.com med navne, aldre og nylige fotos af alle medvirkende. Fort√¶l gerne lidt om jer selv og m√¶rk mailen med "Ans√∏gning reklame - Aarhus".

Vi ser frem til at h√∏re fra jer, der t√∏r v√¶re lidt anderledes og har lyst til en sjov dag p√• settet!

Jessica Lynn

items.title: English and German in-person acting courses in Berlin and online globally with I‚Ä¶
items.summary:
English and German in-person acting courses in Berlin and online globally with Isabelle Mann.

Isabelle is a degree holding international working actress, acting coach, and screenwriter.

Her work is influenced by a long-time collaboration with Robert Castle, a unique director renowned for the evolution of ‚ÄòMethod acting‚Äô and the founder of International Theatre New York, and Susan Batson, one of the most significant Hollywood acting coaches in the world.

Her method is based on ‚ÄòMethod acting‚Äô, a technique originally created by Stanislavsky and further developed by Lee Strasberg, Stella Adler, and Sanford Meisner. The actor is trained to create the character‚Äôs life using the senses, in order to produce a reality. The actor discovers a physical and emotional availability that leads to working moment-to-moment, based on spontaneous organic impulses and their free expression through the character. The technique offers actors the freedom to be emotionally available, and artistically creative in both theatre and film.

Isabelle works with scenes and monologues from well-known playwrights such as Tennessee Williams, Edward Albee, William Shakespeare, Harold Pinter, Caryl Churchill, Alan Ayckbourn, Gotthold Ephraim Lessing, Sibylle Berg, Ingmar Bergman, Jean-Paul Sartre, Dario Fo & Franca Rame et al., film scripts or scenes of your choice.

Students she prepared for auditions at drama schools succeeded in gaining admission to institutions such as the renowned Ernst Busch Academy of Dramatic Arts in Berlin, or completed an acting degree at the Bern University of the Arts, performing the monologues they rehearsed with her. Actors she prepared for film and series roles were subsequently booked for their respective projects.

In addition to her acting career, she is also a certified life coach.

ACTING CLASSES FOR ALL LEVELS

From beginner to highly experienced film and stage actors.

‚Ä¢Intensive individual preparation for auditions at theatres, drama schools or films.

‚Ä¢Intensive individual preparation for film or stage roles.

‚Ä¢Working on monologues and scenes.

‚Ä¢Self-tape training and filming.

‚Ä¢Speech and voice training.

‚Ä¢Individual coaching to support your growth as an artist.

‚Ä¢Insider tips, helping to find the right talent agent, networking tips, etc.

Contact: coaching@isabelle-mann.com

https://www.isabelle-mann.com/en/acting_coach.htm

#isabellemann #actor #actingcoach

All you need to attend this Zoom class is a willingness to explore, something to write with and on, and an RSVP here:

[https://www.soaringsolostudios.com/free-one-person-play-class/](https://www.soaringsolostudios.com/free-one-person-play-class/)

I truly hope you will join the Soaring Solo Community and I for this fabulous free virtual event. Let's turn your solo show dreams into an amazing reality!

Jessica Lynn

Founder & CEO of Soaring Solo Studios

Blogger for NoHo Arts

Director/Teaching Artist for the LA Women's Theatre Festival

Director & Developer of over 175 solo shows

[https://www.soaringsolostudios.com](https://www.soaringsolostudios.com/)

items.title: We‚Äôre currently casting for**"**Fk (-) Boys"** (working title), a Berlin-based s‚Ä¶
items.summary:
We‚Äôre currently casting for**"**Fk (-) Boys"** (working title), a Berlin-based short fiction film directed by **Ilaria Tonetti**.
 

This emotionally raw, visually driven character piece follows a young woman through a night of unexpected connection, self-confrontation, and the fragile hope of healing.

**Location:** Berlin
**Shooting period:** 3‚Äì5 days between 9 and 13 July 2025
**Expenses:** Covered (no fee, travel & food included)

**Story**
After a breakup, Sofia ‚Äì wild, guarded and emotionally bruised ‚Äì meets a charming French stranger and spends one long night wandering through Berlin with him and her friends. But as the hours pass, she must face her fear of intimacy and decide whether she‚Äôs brave enough to let herself be seen, or whether she‚Äôll retreat into the familiar pain she knows best.

**Roles:**

**SOFIA (Female, 20s)**

Energetic, provocative, emotionally layered. Sofia hides vulnerability behind bravado and chaos. A complex and contradictory presence: fierce on the outside, fragile underneath.

 

**THEO (Male, 20s)**

Charming, stylish, emotionally elusive. A golden boy with a hollow centre. Looks like he has it all but fears deep connection.

 

**ALICE (Female, 20s)**

Composed and elegant, the group's steadying force. She hides her dependence behind polished control, terrified of losing grip on who she thinks she is.

 

**MATILDE (Female, 20s)**

Sharp, rebellious, impulsive. The wildcard. She rejects love out loud but secretly longs for it ‚Äì and for Quillan.

 

**QUILLAN (Male, 20s)**

Gentle, romantic, emotionally present. The quiet heart of the group. Steady and sincere in a world of irony and games.

**Interested in auditioning?**
Please send your **CV**, **headshot**, **showreel (if available)** and a few lines about yourself to:
[00457876@metfilmstudents.de](mailto:00457876@metfilmstudents.de)

 

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. We welcome submissions from all backgrounds and identities.

items.title:
üé≠ Castpoint is leveling up!

We‚Äôve just launched a page for employers: castpoin‚Ä¶
items.summary:
üé≠ Castpoint is leveling up!

We‚Äôve just launched a page for employers: castpoint.art/employers
Here they can join the waiting list and get ready for the full platform launch.

üëâ What does this mean for artists?
Soon, employers will be able to:
 ‚Ä¢ Post verified job offers and contracts abroad
 ‚Ä¢ Access the artist database and invite talents directly
 ‚Ä¢ Share feedback about working with specific artists
 ‚Ä¢ Build long-term collaborations with trusted professionals

And for artists, this means:
 ‚Ä¢ Apply to contracts in just one click through your profile

items.title:
**Paid SHORT FILM (with Expenses)**

**'The Woman with the Rose in Her Hair' - F‚Ä¶
items.summary:
**Paid SHORT FILM (with Expenses)**

**'The Woman with the Rose in Her Hair' - FEMALE LEAD **

**Title**: *Will I Ever See You Again*
**Location**: Gower, Swansea, South Wales, UK
**Shoot Dates**: 1 Shoot Day, (2 Travel Days either side - covered) - Late December 2025 - Early January 2026 (TBC)

Fee: **¬£300 plus Food, Travel and Hotel Accommodation Expenses Covered**

A cinematic, romantic and mysterious **dialogue-free** short film exploring memory, love, and identity ‚Äî told through visuals and music. Inspired by Korean Group, **Red Velvet‚Äôs** song *‚ÄúWill I Ever See You Again‚Äù*, the story follows a man with dementia across two timelines, haunted by memories of his lost love.

Stylistically and thematically, the film is similar to the likes of *Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind*, *The Father*, and *Groundhog Day* ‚Äî exploring memory, identity, and emotional connection through visual and poetic storytelling.

We're casting:

**Female Lead** ‚Äì 25‚Äì35, **Asian ethnicity** (North East/East/South East Asian) 
Elegant, expressive, romantic presence. No dialogue ‚Äì naturalistic charm (for flashback sequences) and subtle emotional expression and mystery (for the first half of the project).

Plans for Release:
Once completed, the film will be shared directly with **dementia and Alzheimer‚Äôs care organizations** and their social media platforms as a creative tool to raise awareness and foster empathy around the emotional realities of living with memory loss.

The goal is to reach those affected by dementia‚Äîpatients, families, and caregivers‚Äîoffering a heartfelt and human perspective on the fragility of memory and the powerful bonds we carry with us. As well as just tell a beautiful and sincere story.

To Apply:
Email **rossleyshon@gmail.com** with your **headshot** and **showreel. (*****Mandatory to apply*****) **

We‚Äôre making Falling Forward, Slightly, a 12-minute experimental short film shot in Copenhagen. A poetic story of a swimmer, a fighter, and a dancer colliding in space and time.

**We‚Äôre looking for RED: female (20s‚Äì30s), based in Copenhagen or nearby, available end of September. No dialogue, movement-driven.**
